NewMonopoly

Class IOStreamer

  • java.lang.Object
    • NewMonopoly.IOStreamer

  • class IOStreamer
extends java.lang.Object
    Loads and saves games to specialized .mns files
    Author:
    Miguel Salazar

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IOStreamer()
      Constructor used for new games
      IOStreamer(boolean b)
      Constructor used for saved games
      IOStreamer(java.lang.String sf)
      Constructor used to load previously saved games

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getSaveFile() 
      java.util.ArrayList<Player> IOPlayerReader()
      Reads the player file for a new or saved game and records the data into Player objects to be stored and returned in an ArrayList
      java.util.ArrayList<Property> IOPropReader(GCounter rc, GCounter uc)
      Reads the property and rent files for a new or saved game and records the data into Property objects to be stored and returned in an ArrayList

      Saves the current game under the user defined name
      boolean saveName(java.lang.String name)
      Saves a .mns file only used as a place holder for saved game sessions
      boolean savePlayers(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
      Saves a .mns file that holds the player data for the game session
      boolean saveProperties(java.util.ArrayList<Property> properties)

    • Constructor Detail

      • IOStreamer

        public IOStreamer(java.lang.String sf)
        Constructor used to load previously saved games
        Parameters:
        sf - String name of the saved game

      • IOStreamer

        public IOStreamer()
        Constructor used for new games

      • IOStreamer

        public IOStreamer(boolean b)
        Constructor used for saved games
        Parameters:
        b - boolean value simply to tell apart the two constructors. Boolean value does nothing in the context of the constructor

    • Method Detail

      • getSaveFile

        public java.lang.String getSaveFile()

      • IOPlayerReader

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> IOPlayerReader()
        Reads the player file for a new or saved game and records the data into Player objects to be stored and returned in an ArrayList
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of all active Player objects in the game

      • IOPropReader

        public java.util.ArrayList<Property> IOPropReader(GCounter rc,
                                                  GCounter uc)
        Reads the property and rent files for a new or saved game and records the data into Property objects to be stored and returned in an ArrayList
        Parameters:
        rc - a GCounter object meant to record the number of railroad properties owned
        uc - a GCounter object meant to record the number of utility properties owned
        Returns:
        props an ArrayList of Property objects that is to be used throughout the entirety of the application

      • save

        public void save(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                 java.util.ArrayList<Property> properties)
        Saves the current game under the user defined name
        Parameters:
        players - ArrayList of Player objects containing all the active players in the game
        properties - ArrayList of Property objects containing all properties in the game

      • saveName

        public boolean saveName(java.lang.String name)
        Saves a .mns file only used as a place holder for saved game sessions
        Parameters:
        name - String by which to save the game under
        Returns:
        boolean value declaring if saving was successful. true=successful, false=unsuccessful

      • savePlayers

        public boolean savePlayers(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
        Saves a .mns file that holds the player data for the game session
        Parameters:
        players - Arraylist of Player objects containing all active players in the game
        Returns:
        boolean stating if player characteristics were properly saved

      • saveProperties

        public boolean saveProperties(java.util.ArrayList<Property> properties)
        Saves a .mns file that holds the property data for the game session
        Parameters:
        properties - ArrayList of Property objects containing all properties in the game to save
        Returns:
        boolean value declaring if saving was successful. true=successful, false=unsuccessful
